fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34668].

There's a link for user to add other package into JIRA Logging and Profiling under Default Loggers section. 

It will be useful to add the information if customer wants to add their custom package and turn on logging temporarily:

!temp_logging.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34667].
  {panel}

This is to address the change in UI of the *Progress Indicator* for the [JIRA Roadmap Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Road+Map+Gadget].

As we can see from the original design of the progress indicator, it is designed to be in parallel to show the issues resolved vs. issues not resolved.
!road_map_1.png|thumbnail!

However, after *JIRA 6.0*, it was being split into two different bars:
!road_map_2.png|thumbnail!

If the indicator is not split on two lines you can sort of tell in percent how much is done. It gives us a clearer impression about the state of the release. Any chance that the UI will be restored back to the original way?

Furthermore, the [JIRA Agile Sprint Health Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+the+Sprint+Health+Gadget] implements the original design and it looks much better.
!sprint_health.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA Roadmap Gadget Progress Indicator
Highlight before and after changes on JIRA issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34665].
  {panel}

For example, we have a file attached to the issue and we want to embed it in the comment or description, you have to type in the file name exactly as it is - it is case-sensitive.

E.g., attached is the file *screenshot.PNG*.

Here is what happens when we type in the exact name:
!screenshot.PNG!

And here is what happens when we type in other variations:
!screenshot.png!
!Screenshot.png!
etc.

Here is our JIRA version, but looks like it affects the current unreleased one as well:
!Our JIRA.PNG!

This is a bit inconvenient, especially in Windows, when file extensions are hidden by default.
fields.summary: Attachment names should not be case-sensitive when referenced in the issue description or comments

Email message preview site URL

fields.description:
This issue occurs when upgrading from JIRA 4.1 and earlier and using one of the multi value custom field.  The issue has been documented in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Crashes+while+Creating+an+Issue however a bug report has never been filed.  

h3. Steps to reproduce
# On a JIRA 4.1 instance, create a custom field, of type multi select
# Add a few values to that field
# Run an in-place upgrade to any newer version

h3. Expected Results
Upgrades without issue

h3. Actual Results
JIRA crashes mid-upgrade with stack trace (below) OR upgrade finishes, but crashes when creating an issue.
{noformat}
com.thoughtworks.xstream.mapper.CannotResolveClassException: java.util.Collections-UnmodifiableList : java.util.Collections-UnmodifiableList
at com.thoughtworks.xstream.mapper.DefaultMapper.realClass(DefaultMapper.java:68)
at com.thoughtworks.xstream.mapper.MapperWrapper.realClass(MapperWrapper.java:38)
at com.thoughtworks.xstream.mapper.DynamicProxyMapper.realClass(DynamicProxyMapper.java:71)
at com.thoughtworks.xstream.mapper.MapperWrapper.realClass(MapperWrapper.java:38)
at com.thoughtworks.xstream.mapper.PackageAliasingMapper.realClass(PackageAliasingMapper.java:88)
...
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

See the KB article at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Crashes+while+Creating+an+Issue
fields.summary: Upgrade task for Multi Value Custom Fields coming from JIRA 4.1
Jira IssueSearchEvent, IssueViewEvent are not triggered reliably

fields.description: Reviewing the instructions on the Configuration page for the Multi Select field type: bq. HTML (e.g.: My Option) may be entered in option values. Be sure to 'escape' literal <'s with < and >'s with > (e.g.:Apples < Oranges) Using a hyperlink in the field as has worked in previous versions: {noformat}Customer Name, TD{noformat} However, this link will now break the auto-complete in the Issue Navigator's Basic mode, and is almost impossible to select in Advanced mode.
fields.summary: Using hyperlinks in a Multi Select field breaks the Issue Navigator
Ability to define default fields displayed on the screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34653].
  {panel}

When using the Issue Navigator, I'm only able to invoke autocomplete to assist with completing the user's Full Name, not the Email Address or Username.

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Install JIRA
# Set up JIRA with a new database
# Create at least one user
-# Example: username foobar, full name Some Guy, email test@example.com
# Using the Issue Navigator to search the Reporter field in Basic mode:
-# Typing Some will invoke the picker with Some Guy as a suggestion
-# Typing foo will invoke the user picker, but with no suggestions
-# Typing test will invoke the user picker, but with no suggestions
# Using the User Picker for Assignee field in Quick Edit will provide suggestions for all three input types
-# This is the behaviour we expect in the Issue Navigator as well.

h5. Expected behaviour:
- Users will be able to draw suggestions from any of the user name parameters (email, full name, username)
fields.summary: As a User, I would like the Issue Navigator to auto complete users' Email and Username, in addition to their Real Name.

fields.description:
It seems that in the normal jira usage you may end-up having subtasks without parents (don't ask me how but that's the reality).

JIRA will convert them to Bugs on the first edit, UNLESS you are trying to update them using REST and in this case it will fail with this message.

I understood that REST is suppose to work like the normal interface but obviously it doesn't.

This bug affects us because it breaks all our automations scripts, scripts that are supposed to update tickets.
fields.summary: HTTP 400: "Issue type is a sub-task but parent issue key or id not specified."

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34647].
  {panel}

A simple switch in confluence instance base url would break the confluence gadget in JIRA dashboard.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# jira url:jira.com:8080, confluence url: wiki.com:8090
# Configure the application links with trusted or OAuth
# Add a confluence QuickNav gadget in JIRA with the following URL:
{code}
http://wiki.com:8090/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets:gadget-search/gadgets/gadget-search.xml
{code}
# Add the gadget and configure spaces, pages
# The gadget should review the pages correctly.
# Proceed to Confluence and switch the base url to mywiki.com:8090


h3. Actual Result:

The gadget in JIRA dashboard throws error when it unable to reach the old url.
{code}
Requests to http://wiki.com:8090/rest/gadget/1.0/pagegadget/getrenderedpage.json?pageId=917506 are not allowed. See your administrator about configuring a whitelist entry for this destination (http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/KQfCDQ ).
{code}

h3. Expected Result:

It seems to be intended behaviour which the gadget rely on the gadget url. However, there are chances that the url of the instance may be change and switch. 

It's a painful process for customer to add the gadget again to their dashboard and the approach unable to edit the gadget for all users at one time.

For better customer experience, the following suggestion can be implemented:
* Allow customer to modify the gadget url that added into JIRA through the gadget list so they don't have to add the gadget again. Otherwise, may possible to allow the gadget to work dynamically so it can detect the url of the instance automatically.
* Create a better integration in terms of adding cross platform gadget. For instance, customer can authenticate first so he has the rights to select a application and add the gadgets into JIRA. The interface can be similar to issue linking interface.

h5. Workaround
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Change+URLs+of+External+Gadgets+in+Jira
fields.summary: Better handling of changes to the base url for external gadgets

 - If I click on Add Project, it makes nothing. The workaround for this is going selecting any other Admin menu, going through the password validation, and then coming back to this screen to add a project.

fields.description:
As per our documentation page - [Connecting JIRA to Oracle|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+Oracle]. The database-type property in {{dbconfig.xml}} should be configured as "oracle11g". see below:

{code}
 ....
  <delegator-name>default</delegator-name>
  <database-type>oracle11g</database-type>
  <jdbc-datasource>
  ....
{code}
Which apparently not recognize by JIRA:
{code}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Could not find a field-type definition with name "oracle11g"
{code}

h4.Workaround:

# Change the database-type property to "oracle10g" instead.
{code}
 ....
  <delegator-name>default</delegator-name>
  <database-type>oracle10g</database-type>
  <jdbc-datasource>
  ....
{code}
# Restart JIRA
fields.summary: Inconsistency in the field type definition for Oracle11g

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34624].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently our documentation instructs how create a self-signed certificate using keystore type as *JKS*, configure the SSL connector and check the certificate as in this [excerpt|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS?src=search#RunningJIRAoverSSLorHTTPS-ConfiguringyourwebserverusingtheJIRAconfigurationtool] of our documentation.

h3. The problem
The problem is that there are others keystore types, such as *PKCS12* for example and when using JIRA configuration tool to insert the SSL configuration, it will always define keystore type as *JKS* into the {{server.xml}}.

If we want to define a different keystore type, the only option available is manually edit it into the {{server.xml}} file. It would be much easier if we had a field to adjust this setting in JIRA configuration tool.
fields.summary: Include an option to define keystoreType when using JIRA configuration tool

fields.description:
Example Steps to reproduce:
# assign the Assign Issue permissions to all roles
# Add the following into property the Workflow Step:
{code}
jira.permission.assign.projectrole.1=10002
jira.permission.assign.projectrole.2=10001
{code}
(i) or refer to screenshot Property.png
# expected result will the user with roles Administrators(id=10002) and Developers(id=10001) will be able to see the Assign Issue button or Assignee field in that step. However, only user Administrator will be able to see the Assign button/Assignee field

This is NOT reproducible with multiple Groups:
# assign the Assign Issue permissions to all groups
# Add the property  the Workflow Step:
{code}
jira.permission.assign.group.1=jira-administrators
jira.permission.assign.group.2=jira-developers
{code}
# all users that has membership to jira-administrators or jira-developers will be able to see the Assign Button/Assignee field
fields.summary: Workflow Properties does not accept multiple project roles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34619].
  {panel}

*Background of The Request*

As of now, JIRA does not have the ability to read LDAP password policy and inform their registered users regarding the password policy in place in the LDAP server.

It would be great if JIRA has the ability to recognize the password policy set in the integrated LDAP server and use that information to inform/warn their users.

For example:

When a user password almost expired, JIRA could inform the customer and ask them to change their password trough the correct procedure.

Another example, is when JIRA has the ability to write into LDAP server, it could specifically inform the users if the password set by them is incorrect based on the password policy in place.
fields.summary: JIRA to recognize LDAP Password Policy

fields.description:
Need the menu behaviour from jira 5 to be implemented in Jira 6

When you click/activate the menu item "agile", it shows you a dropdown list, the content of the menu point.
Could it be changed to the same behaviour as in jira 5: In Jira 5 this action sent you directly to the place you lasted visited under this menu point.

The only way to use this shortcut is by using the keyboard shortcuts e.g "g" followed "a" and this is only a few of our users that can remember those.

Please implement this feature again and as before let the smal arrow beside the menu point activate the full drop Down list of menu items.

BR
Bjarne Sehested
fields.summary: Menu behavior in jira 6 need the functionality from Jira 5

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34610].
  {panel}

Seems to be somewhat related to JRA-9367.

h3. Steps to reproduce
h5. Option 1
# In List View in the Issue Navigator, add a custom field to the list of columns.
# Drag it left so it's not the right-most column.
# Refresh the page and that column should disappear (as per JRA-9367).
# Transition one of the issues through the workflow.

Prior to Step 4 above, the issue navigator looks like this:

!before.png!

Afterwards it looks like this:

!after.png!

The "Example" text is from the custom field that was added in Step 1, and is positioned in Step 2.

h5. Option 2
This can also be reproduced when a custom field (with a single project context) is added to the issue nav with results from more than the original project
# In List View (Issue Navigator), add a custom field (with a single project context)
# Click on an issue (to get to the view issue page) that does not have a value for that custom field
# Click back in the browser

This is what the issue nav looks like before:
!before-2.png!

After clicking back, the values in the column have been shifted:
!after-2.png!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34592].
  {panel}

People sometimes comment on JIRA items purely via the 'comment' action; at other times, their comment is made as part of another change to the issue. In the latter case, the context of their comment is often highly dependent on the action they are performing at a time. For example, in a comment made from a smart commit message, the comment is usually a description of the code commit being made. This breaks up the flow of the comments and often makes it difficult to unscramble what people are talking about.

It would be great if comments that were made in the context of other actions (such as reassigning issues, editing metadata, smart commits) were annotated in some way with an indication of the action. I believe that Bugzilla does this.

I could use the Activity tab to see the context of a comment, but the comment text in this tab is too small for everyday use. A little annotation in the Comments tab would really help.

Thoughts?
fields.summary: Annotate comments with the action that generated the comment
Ability to add snippets to JIRA fields
Third-party add-ons should have "Get Started" button

fields.description:
When you have the Resolution field hidden in your Field configuration, Watched Issues gadget only displays issues if you have the 'Include resolved issues' feature enabled, even if they are newly created and don't have any resolution set.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
Create new Issue and watch the issue;
Modify the Field Configuration being used by the issue's project and hide the Resolution field;
View the Watched Issues gadget.

*Desired Behavior:*
JIRA would show the issues that were watched by the user.

*Actual Behavior:*
JIRA does not display any issues that use the Field Configuration where the Resolution field is hidden.

*Workaround:*
Either make the Resolution field visible again in the Field Configuration, or enable the 'Include resolved issues' feature in the Watched Issues gadget.
fields.summary: Watched Issues gadget doesn't show unresolved issues when project doesn't have Resolution field

fields.description:
When a webhook URL has a port specified (like :5000), a 500 error is generated:
{noformat}
2013-08-30 05:56:05,198 webhooks-http-retriever:thread-4 
ERROR      [webhooks.util.http.CachingHttpContentRetriever] 
Unable to post to http://bamboo.mysite.org:5000/deploy due to HTTP/1.0 500 INTERNAL SERVER ERROR
{noformat}
This problem does NOT exist for webhook URLs without a port specified.

Also, I was unable to put quotes around the URL in the UI, nor was I able to escape the colon character, likely due to input validation. This is fine, but wanted to give further context into steps taken to work around the issue.

Please fix, as we are not always able to run our APIs through port 80.

Thanks!
fields.summary: 500 Internal Error when a webhook URL that contains a port specification is triggered

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34586].
  {panel}

Every time we create an issue in JIRA through the "Create Issue" screen we can see a button located at the top right corner of the pop up called "Configure Fields" - by clicking this button we can see the "Where is my field?" option.

!pop_up.png!

However, this it not true when creating a new ticket from JIRA's administrative area, instead JIRA opens the screen on the page and does not open the pop up window. There is no "Configure Fields" inside this page nor the "Where is my field?" option.

!page.png!
fields.summary: "Where is my field?" option doesn't appear when creating issue from administrative area

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34583].
  {panel}

First I have to say, that I like all Atlassian product. Especially because of the well integration between your products. It is easy to find relevant information and navigate between the systems. E.g I can navigate from Jira to a Bamboo build regarding the selected issue. Or I can see the build and test results of Bamboo in my build tab of the issue. Perfect!!
I think the reason is, that the Atlassian strategy wants to make things easier.

No I found something which conflicts with your concept regarding Stash
* I have an Issue and the regarding code changes in an Git Branch.
* Now I have created a Pull Request in Stash and of course somebody should review my changes.
* The review was successful and I have merged the branch into the master over Stash.

PERFECT usability, but:
From the Jira-Issue view:

* Where can I see that the Pull request was approved?
* Where is the "green/red color" which indicates the state?
* How can I navigate directly to the relevant Pull request? The number is available, but not a link. I can navigate to everything (Project, Repository, Source, Commit) but not the important Pull-Request. It is possible to navigate from the Pull request to the issue but not from the issue to the Pull request.

I can not believe that this is not implemented..... This follows not the Atlassian strategy "Make things easier"

I hope this functionality will come soon. It is a must...
fields.summary: Stash status (Merged and Approved) & Pull request link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34582].
  {panel}

Every Atlassian application has different scripts formats and workflow. We should have a common format guidelines to make them consistent between applications.

This will bring us the following wins:
* Sysadmins of Atlassian products will be able to configure any product in the same way, reducing the learning curve.
* Some pages in the documentation (and also the KB space) would be valid for all products, making them easier to maintain.

I personally like the way the files are formatted in JIRA (and Bamboo) but we should agree in a common format.
fields.summary: Get consistent start, stop, configuration and installation scripts across Atlassian products
As a JIRA Admin, I'd like to be able to export group members
Authentication Problem calling POST Request to REST API inside Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34578].
  {panel}

Jira Version 6 incorporated the Detailed Views that allow editing issues directly from the Issue Navigator. -[JRA-7133|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-7133]-

Users are requesting for fields to be editable directly from the field value.

*The reasons are:*
* [The moment you shift to details view from the list view, all you can read about the issue is it's name on the left side panel and details screen on the right side panel.|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-7133?focusedCommentId=488592&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-488592]
* this would be much easier
to edit than clicking on the cog icon or going to the detailed view screen
fields.summary: Allow field value editing directly in issue navigator

fields.description:
Customers have reported that JRA-25220 is still occurring. I suspect there is an edge case that we missed.

User "A" was in the Role of Developer for a JIRA Project.  User "A" was a user that came from an external AD/LDAP directory.  When that user was removed from the AD/LDAP directory, the project manager tried to remove that user from the Developer Project Role w/in the Project.  However JIRA puts up an error message that the user cannot be found and therefore cannot be removed from the Project Role.

Need to be able to remove users from Project Roles when they no longer exist in an external AD/LDAP directory.
fields.summary: Regression: AD/LDAP directory user who is no longer in that directory cannot be removed from Project Role within a Project

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# From LDAP, delete a user that has been added to a project role in a JIRA project.
# Attempt to remove the user from the project role in JIRA. JIRA returns an error that the named user cannot be found. The user doesn't appear to be removed from the Project Role.
# After a restart the user seems to be removed from the project role, but the bad role is still present in the database; it just fails to load with an error message in the log.

h3. Workaround

# Add the user to the internal directory.
# Delete them from the project role.
# Remove that user (it's recommend to deactivate them instead as per [Managing Users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Users#ManagingUsers-Deactivatingauser]).
fields.summary: Deleted LDAP User cannot be removed from Project Role

fields.description:
This is not fixed for 6.0.7.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create 2 projects in fresh JIRA instance (eg. project *test* and project *B*).
# Create an issues in both projects (eg. test-123, pb-1).
# Now create a new filter like this:
{noformat}
issuekey in (TEST-123, PB-1)
{noformat}
# Remove the user's *'Browser Project'* permission of project *test*.
# After that, go back to the same filter. An error shown that the key for TEST-123 is invalid and change to issue key *11305*. Please see attached:
!IssueKey.png|thumbnail!

Additional info:
# If you search by projects, the same behavior occurs: 
!Project.png|thumbnail!
# If, at a later time the user is allowed to view the project again, the issue key and project key automatically reverts back to the correct values, and the filter will be valid again.
fields.summary: Issue key change to Issue ID after an error message occured in JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34559].
  {panel}

It would be great to have a chart gadget that gives an overview of total issues available on a timeline, and breaks-down the total number of issues at a time into another field (like issue-type, project etc.) using a staked bar-graph.

This is basically providing a combination of information in one gadget, that is currently provided by two different JIRA Gadgets, namely:
(1) Pie Chart gadget: which can shows issues broken down by a field.
(2) Time Since Chart gadget: Bar graph that shows total issues on a timeline. (Would like to see the bar graph, but have the bars colored / sectioned by issue type, project etc.).
fields.summary: Staked Bar Graph showing total number of issues created on a timeline, broken down by other field like Issue Types, Projects etc.

Is there a way to do this?

Thanks
Anand
fields.summary: Creating issue at a particular day in Jelly Script
Jira should read from OpenLDAP a flag to make users inactive
Attachments folder should Automatically be moved When Restoring an OnDemand Backup to Download Version

fields.description:
A custom field of type Message Custom Field (from the JIRA Toolkit plugin) can contain arbitrary HTML as its default value.

If the field value contains an HTML table, then the bulk edit form is broken when bulk-editing issues that include that field.

The bulk-edit screen lays out fields for edit in a table, but closes the table when it comes to the offending custom filed. Subsequent fields are poorly formatted without an enclosing table.

This was OK in version 4, but we noticed it after upgrade to 6.0.
fields.summary: A Message Custom Field containing a HTML table breaks the bulk edit form

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34552].
  {panel}

When Clicking the Help icon (?) on the 'Application Access' admin page
<instance-name>plugins/servlet/applinks/listApplicationLinks
 you are taken to the page: 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Adding+an+Application+Link
where you see the error message:

*No Permission*
You cannot view this page due to inherited restrictions
Page level restrictions have been applied to a parent of the current page. These restrictions limit access to certain user(s) or group(s) and apply to all pages underneath the parent.
fields.summary: Application Links Help Documentation not showing due to permission restriction

fields.description:
Due to a bug in the Shared Access Layer, one of the libraries JIRA uses, attempts to connect over non-standard ports (such as 8443) will not work properly. This can cause AppLinks to fail when attempting to connect to JIRA as the 'Host' HTTP header is always missing the port, regardless of the actual URL.
h3. Example scenarios

For affected versions in JIRA, refer to this issue. This table assumes the applications are listening on different IPs/ running on different servers so they can both listen on the same port numbers.


||JIRA affected?||Port||Target affected?||Port||Can establish Application Link?||
|(/)|8443|(x)|443|(/)|
|(/)|8443|(/)|8443|(x)|
|(/)|443|(x)|443|(/)|
|(/)|443|(/)|443|(/)|
|(/)|443|(x)|8443|(x)|
|(x)|8443|(x)|8443|(/)|
|(x)|443|(/)|8443|(x)|
|(x)|443|(/)|443|(/)|

This is a bug kept in place to track the problem in JIRA - when SAL is upgraded this problem will be resolved. Other products are kept track in the following issues:
 * Stash: -STASH-3777-
 * Bamboo: -BAM-13987-
 * Confluence: -CONF-31627-

(!) Any Atlassian application that has not had this bug fixed will require the workaround. For example, JIRA 6.1.3 is fixed however Confluence 5.3.1 is not so the applications would not be able to communicate with each other over HTTPS ports that are anything other than 443.
h3. Workaround 1 - altering {{server.xml}}

Modify the remote application's {{server.xml}} to include the following arguments in the HTTPS Connector and restart the application:
{code:xml|title=server.xml}
proxyName="remote application server name"
proxyPort="remote application SSL port (e.g. 8443)"

{code}
h3. Workaround 2 - using a Reverse Proxy

Host JIRA behind a reverse-proxy, such as Apache using [Integrating JIRA with Apache using SSL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache+using+SSL].

This will serve HTTPS on port 443 on Apache, however JIRA will be serving HTTP behind that proxy, effectively working around the problem. It is the recommendation of Atlassian Support to use this configuration over setting up HTTPS on Tomcat as the configuration of it is considered to be easier to achieve.
h3. Workaround 3 - using Tomcat

Depending upon the application(s) that are affected, running them directly on port 443 can correct the problem as per our [Application Stash seems to be offline in JIRA after creating an application link to Stash|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=407725576] KB. This is only recommended for Windows installations as {{root}} access is required for Tomcat to listen on 443 - on Linux installs and this carries a significant security risk with it (if someone hacks Tomcat they have {{root}} access to the box).
fields.summary: Unable to create AppLink to JIRA on a non-standard HTTPS port (other than 443)
jira.atlassian.com doesn't reflect user profile images stored in atlassian.id

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Have a Dashboard that has a short gadget or that is currently empty;
# Try to click on the _dropdown_ menu icon.

h3. Actual Results:

You are not able to edit it as the menu is longer than the current page and no additional scroll appears.

!Screen Shot 2013-09-16 at 7.38.01 PM.png!

h3. Expected Results:

The page should "grow" the necessary to accommodate the menu and not causing this problem.

h3. Workaround:

No available workarounds.

h3. Notes:

Tested using Chrome v. 29.0.1547.57
fields.summary: JIRA Dashboard cut the Gadget options

fields.description:
Users shouldn't be able to edit their user profile/name with External Management ON.

Produces a nasty stack-trace that confuses users.

Regression of JRA-2704
fields.summary: Edit Profile allowed even with External Management set to ON

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34546].
  {panel}

It appears some SEs don't have permission to update the following KB: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Story+Points+Not+Shown+in+the+Sprint+Report.

It may be a good idea to add (one of) the following related JAC tickets to that KB:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-8776
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-8507
fields.summary: Request to add related JAC ticket to "https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Story+Points+Not+Shown+in+the+Sprint+Report" Knowledge base article

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34545].
  {panel}

Often I realize that a user is not available in the asignee field because they are not added to an assignable user role, so that means that I have to go back to the admin and add them to a role.

It would be nice if:

- I started typing the username and it displayed greyed out, grouped in a category saying "Not in assignable user role" or something of the like
- Upon selecting the unassignable user, JIRA would prompt me to add the user to an assignable role
- Once the role is selected in the prompt, the user appears in the field as an assignee

Without this not only project administrators need to go all the way to the backend, but not all project administrators know how to do this. This means that adding a user to a project can require 2 project administrators at a time in order to coordinate the change to the project configuration.
fields.summary: As a project administrator, I would like to be able to add new users to a project role from the assignee field in an issue

fields.description:
I created a "technicaluser" to receive notifications on a specific email address, whatever the issue visibility is (I want a notification to this distribution list even for non Public issues).

I have edited the permission scheme to notifiy this single user "technicaluser" for any events.

This account never received notifications whereas Notification Helper says it should... until I added "technicaluser" to group "jira-users" and related project roles so that it gains permissions on issues.

I consider Notification Helper should report this security check as cause of lacking notifications.
fields.summary: Notification Helper reports falsy a user is notified
Services Delay

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# install JIRA
# create multiple users
# login as one of the user and user has option to disable this feature and it seems to be accessible via User's Profile . Refer to screenshot WhatsNew.pmg
# go to User Profile, but the option is not available . refer to screenshot Profile.png 

This means that user does not have the option to enable or disable this feature from their own profile.

This is tested with JIRA 6.0.6
fields.summary: JIRA Welcome Plugin is not accessible in User Profile
